snippet: The London High Court quashed the government’s decision not to hold a public investigation into the murder of a Russian spy in London in 2006.
abstract: London High Court rules that British government will have to reconsider opening public inquiry into death of Russian spy Alexander Litvinenko in London in 2006 after he was poisoned with radioactive substance; ruling may result in reexamination of diplomatically sensitive issue; inquiry could delve into whether Russia was involved in death.
lead_paragraph: The London High Court quashed the government’s decision not to hold a public investigation into the murder of a Russian spy in London in 2006.

headline.main: Britain: Court Orders Government to Reconsider Spy Death Inquiry
headline.print_headline: Britain: Court Orders Government to Reconsider Spy Death Inquiry
